recommendations.recommendation: Very colorful, ridiculous, and funny. Great music is another plus. Despite clumsy ending - more please! ^_^ Encore!

anime.description: In a rural town undergoing revival through music, high school students http://anidb.net/ch82426 [Kanae] and http://anidb.net/ch82425 [Sousuke] meet none other than http://anidb.net/ch84070 [Beethoven] and http://anidb.net/ch84071 [Mozart]! Calling themselves Classicaloids, these mysterious two create a strange power through the music they play that makes stars fall from the sky and giant robots appear. Later, http://anidb.net/ch84075 [Bach], http://anidb.net/ch84069 [Chopin] and http://anidb.net/ch84068 [Schubert] also emerge as Classicaloids. What is the mystery behind the powers they possess? Are they humanity`s friends or foes? Source: MoCa News

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: ED variety
tag.description: Several ED sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique ED for each episode.

tag.name: rock music
tag.description: Rock music is a genre of popular music that originated as "rock and roll" in the United States in the 1950s, and developed into a range of different styles in the 1960s and later, particularly in the United Kingdom and the United States. Musically, rock has centered on the electric guitar, usually as part of a rock group with electric bass guitar and drums. Typically, rock is song-based music usually with a 4/4 time signature using a verse-chorus form, but the genre has become extremely diverse. Like pop music, lyrics often stress romantic love but also address a wide variety of other themes that are frequently social or political in emphasis. The dominance of rock by white, male musicians has been seen as one of the key factors shaping the themes explored in rock music. Rock places a higher degree of emphasis on musicianship, live performance, and an ideology of authenticity than pop music.

tag.name: techno music
tag.description: Techno music is a type of electronic and dance music. It emphasizes rhythm and utilizes advancements in music technology and production. Stylistically, techno is generally repetitive instrumental music, oftentimes produced for use in a continuous DJ set. The central rhythmic component is most often in common time (4/4), where time is marked with a bass drum on each quarter note pulse, a backbeat played by snare or clap on the second and fourth pulses of the bar, and an open hi-hat sounding every second eighth note. The tempo tends to vary between approximately 120 to 150 beats per minute (bpm), depending on the style of techno. The creative use of music production technology, such as drum machines, synthesizers, and digital audio workstations, is viewed as an important aspect of the music`s aesthetic. The anmie features a vast amount of techno music, or simply revolves around the genre.

tag.name: classical music
tag.description: Classical music is art music produced or rooted in the traditions of Western music (both liturgical and secular). It encompasses a broad span of time from roughly the 11th century to the present day. Anime tagged have classical music as a central theme.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

episode.title: さまよえる後輩
Wandering Kouhai
방황하는 후배
Samayoeru Kouhai
episode.summary: Schubert finds himself in a strange, far-away land, seeking the great Beethoven. He leaves a trail of babies in his wake. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チョッちゃんとリッちゃん
Cho-chan and Lisz-chan
촛짱과 릿짱
Chocchan to Licchan
episode.summary: Liszt visits Otowakan for an open house tour. One of her buddies is already there, ready to move in. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出せ! ムジーク
Get It! Musik!
나와라! 무지크
Dase! Music
episode.summary: Kanae`s birthday is approaching. Sousuke, desperate to see more Muzik action, takes the opportunity to try to get it to work in Mozart. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ベトとモツと音羽館
Beethes and Motes and Otowakan
베토와 모츠와 오토와관
Beto to Motsu to Otowa Kan
episode.summary: Kanae, the owner of Otowakan, is about to sell the place and move out. But Beethoven and Mozart refuse to leave, and Sousuke refuses to take his music gear. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 漆黒のギョーザー
Jet-Black Gyoza
칠흑의 만두
Shikkoku no Gyouzar
episode.summary: Beethoven`s pursuit of the Jet-black Gyoza becomes an obsession for everyone at Otowakan, while the ClassicaLoids` continued defection makes Bach feel poco a poco meno rilassato. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 女子会の一日
Girls` Day Out
여성 모임의 하루
Joshikai no Ichinichi
episode.summary: Liszt-san treats Kanae, Tchaiko and Badako to a girls` day out. They share their innermost feelings, and things get weird. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: やまのおう
Mountain King
산의 왕
Yama no Ou
episode.summary: Motes goes nuts in the mountains, setting off rumors of a Hamagon creature prowling the streets. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 始まりのクラシカロイド
The Beginning of the Classicaloids
클래시컬로이드의 시작
Hajimari no Classicaloid
episode.summary: Kanae`s dad calls on Sousuke`s tablet, revealing a little about the non-human nature of the ClassicaLoids. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: J・S・バッハ
J. S. Bach
J · S · 바흐
J. S. Bach
episode.summary: Beethes and Motes audition to become idols. The great J. S. Bach seems to be behind it all, but for what reason? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: せめて, 家事くらい
At Least Do the Chores
적어도, 가사 정도는
Semete, Kaji Kurai
episode.summary: Kanae is leaving Otowakan for a while. She assigns chores to the tenants to do in the meantime, but it`s not clear that she`ll ever be able to leave. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愛しのジョリー
My Beloved Jolly
사랑스런 졸리
Itoshi no Jolly
episode.summary: Chopin discovers an Alchedol app online. He creates a new idol and names her Jolly. Things go south when he realizes he`s infatuated with an inanimate object -- or do they? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇, その向こう
Beyond the Darkness
어둠, 그 너머
Yami, Sono Mukou
episode.summary: Beethes shuts himself in for days on end. When Kanae and the other tenants finally bust down his door, they find him trying to build a guitar. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ます
Die Forelle
숭어
Masu
episode.summary: Schubert becomes a fish. You know what that means! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 働け! ベト モツ
Work! Beethes Motes
일해! 베토 모츠
Hatarake! Beto Motsu
episode.summary: Beethes and Motes go job hunting. Liszt becomes a sculptor. Chopin travels. Schubert goes out to find Beethes and Motes. Merleopon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地獄の学園祭
School Festival from Hell
지옥의 학원제
Jigoku no Gakuensai
episode.summary: Sousuke runs his big mouth, telling people at school that he`s singing in a band for the upcoming school festival. He begs the ClassicaLoids for their help. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 解散するクラクラ, デビューする歌苗
Claskey Klasky Breaks Up, Kanae Makes Her Debut
해산하는 클라클라, 데뷔하는 카나에
Kaisan Suru Kurakura, Debut Suru Kanae
episode.summary: Claskey Klasky breaks up, and Kanae is recruited to take Tchaiko`s place. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: そうだったんだ! アニメ『クラシカロイド』
Episode S1
Sou Dattanda! Anime "Classicaloid"
その名はモーツァルト
Mozart Is the Name
그 이름은 모차르트
Sono Na wa Mozart
episode.summary: Mozart`s mischief finally upsets Otowakan enough to impose a prank ban on him. He doesn`t take it too well. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋すれば死す
Love, and You Shall Die
사랑하면 죽는다
Koi Sureba Shisu
episode.summary: Tchaiko and Bądarzewska get fired. They get in a huge fight, and find themselves trapped in Otowakan along with its residents. Hasshie von Rothbart plays a twisted game on them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ミツルロイドとギョウナくん
Mitsuruloid and Gyouna-kun
미츠루로이드와 교나 군
Mitsuruloid to Gyouna-kun
episode.summary: Mitsuru builds a Sousuke-bot. It terrorizes the city. Mozart and Beethoven try to stop it, but they make things even worse, until Bach steps in. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みかん! みかん! 焼きみかん?!
Mandarins! Mandarins! Fried Mandarins?
귤! 귤! 구운 귤?!
Mikan! Mikan! Yaki Mikan?!
episode.summary: Fried mandarins promise to cure Kanae`s flu. Side effects include music, moonwalking, and abject terror. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ちがいのわかるおとこ
A Discerning Man
차이를 아는 남자
Chigai no Wakaru Otoko
episode.summary: Beethoven`s pursuit of the perfect coffee becomes something a lot more than that. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ブレイク・スルー
Breakthrough
브레이크 스루
Break Through
episode.summary: Schubert has finally had it, and it`s time for his Schu-san Redemption. Domo Arigato, Mr. Avocado! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 八音の世界・後編
The World of Eight Sounds: Part 2
8음의 세계 후편
Hachion no Sekai: Kouhen
episode.summary: Kanae is tapped to go on a quest to shut down the Octavas. Everyone at Otowakan wants to join her party, but someone has to stay behind to defend Otowakan from the Bachifieds. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 八音の世界・前編
The World of Eight Sounds: Part 1
8음의 세계 전편
Hachion no Sekai: Zenpen
episode.summary: Bach`s plans for the eight ClassicaLoids is revealed, but Mitsuru has ideas of her own. "World domination" may or may not be an understatement. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宇宙からのアンコール
Encore from the Skies
우주로부터의 앙코르
Uchuu kara no Encore
episode.summary: They saw, they came, they swooned. Otowakan`s extraterrestrial audience terrorizes the earth with their superior taste in music. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: EP21 Insert Song No Beeping Ver.
